title: APT28 Targeted European Entities Using Webhook-Based Macro Malware
summary:
The Russia-linked state-sponsored threat actor tracked as APT28 has been attributed to a new campaign targeting specific entities in Western and Central Europe.
The activity, per S2 Grupo's LAB52 threat intelligence team, was active between September 2025 and January 2026. It has been codenamed Operation MacroMaze.

title: Wormable XMRig Campaign Uses BYOVD Exploit and Time-Based Logic Bomb
summary:

title: How Exposed Endpoints Increase Risk Across LLM Infrastructure
summary: As more organizations run their own Large Language Models (LLMs), they are also deploying more internal services and Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) to support those models. Modern security risks are being introduced less from the models themselves and more from the infrastructure that serves, connects and automates the model.

title: Malicious npm Packages Harvest Crypto Keys, CI Secrets, and API Tokens
summary:
